intro: Zygostates juliae, commonly known as the Julia's zygostates, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited habitat and rarity, Zygostates juliae is considered an endangered species.
